'''NetDrive''' is a drive mapping utility based on [[Webdrive]] technology initially developed by South River Technolologies and licensed by [[Novell]] for distribution with [[Novell]] [[NetWare]] servers. NetDrive uses the iFolders protocol to map a drive letter on a Windows workstation to a [[NetWare]] server. This software's features are:
*Data transfer by drag and drop files in Windows explorer *Able to execute .exe files including video and audio files *Able to run NetDrive as a system service when Windows starts *Mounts drive automatically on system start *Support FTP, WebDAV, iFolder and SFTP.
The software has been discontinued by Novell, and is no longer available from that company.
